overall_goal: Apply the complete visual identity of "Academia Emer" (medical emergency courses) to an existing web and mobile application without modifying any logic, flow, functionality, component structure, or system behavior, strictly adhering to visual styles (CSS/variables/classes/themes).
active_constraints: - NO modification of JavaScript, business logic, flows, validations, routes, states, APIs, or functional structure. - ONLY apply visual styles (CSS / variables / classes / themes). - Mandatory color palette: Primary: `#ba1557`, Secondary: `#515151`, Neutral: `#FFFFFF`.
key_knowledge: - The application is built with Laravel and uses Blade templating. - Tailwind CSS is integrated and configured via `tailwind.config.js`. - Primary CSS files are `public/assets/frontend/default/css/style.css` and `public/assets/frontend/default/css/custom_style.css`. - The CSS variable `--color-1` in `style.css` is crucial for many accent colors across the site, including active navigation links and hover states. - Browser caching is a recurring issue for the user not seeing the applied CSS changes. - The `gradient-border2` class is a wrapper `div` that applies a 1px gradient border effect to its child elements, used in conjunction with `gradient-border-btn` for specific button styles. (This approach was attempted and reverted as it did not produce the desired visual for the user).
